column4: UPDATE 2-Aerie's eye drug succeeds in trial  shares hit life high
column5: June 25 Drug developer Aerie Pharmaceuticals Inc  said its experimental glaucoma drug  which is a combination of two drugs  was found more effective than the two individual drugs in a mid-stage trial  sending the company's shares to a life high.

column4: Aerie Pharma's combo eye drug succeeds  shares soar
column5: Drug developer Aerie Pharmaceuticals Inc said its single-drop eye treatment was shown to be superior to each of its two components in a mid-stage trial  sending its shares up by about 24 percent in premarket trading.

column4: Aerie Pharma's eye drug succeeds in mid-stage trial
column5: June 25 Drug developer Aerie Pharmaceuticals Inc  said its once-daily eye treatment was shown to be superior to each of its two components in a mid-stage trial.

column4: Google sets sights on TVs  cars and watches  beyond mere smartphones
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc's   Android software is coming to cars  televisions and watches this year  as the Internet search giant races against Apple Inc  and other tech companies to extend its business into a rapidly broadening field of Internet-connected devices.

column4: UPDATE 2-Google sets sights on TVs  cars and watches  beyond mere smartphones

column4: Google unveils 'Fit' health  fitness tracking platform
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc unveiled a "Google Fit" platform on Wednesday to help users of its Android mobile software collate and keep track of health and fitness data on smartwatches and other mobile devices.

column4: Google unveils "Fit" health  fitness tracking platform

column4: Google says first cars running Android Auto software to roll out this year
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc said on Wednesday the first cars running Android Auto will hit showrooms later this year  after the Internet search giant signed on 40 auto-industry partners for its car-software development alliance.

column4: Google sets sights beyond smartphones at annual developer conference
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  June 25 Google Inc    whose Android software reigns as the world's dominant smartphone operating system  will step up efforts to make inroads into cars  televisions and other devices at its annual developer conference this week  sources familiar with the matter said.

column4: Google to unveil new television set-top box on Wednesday: WSJ
column5: Google Inc is expected to unveil at least one small set-top box that resembles products like the Roku  Amazon's Fire TV  and Apple Inc's Apple TV  the Wall Street Journal reported citing sources who have seen the device.

column4: Japan Display's reliance on iPhone orders rises in 2013-14
column5: TOKYO Japan Display Inc  the world's biggest smartphone LCD maker  got a third of its revenue from Apple Inc in the year to March  growing more reliant on the iPhone even as it seeks to bump up orders from fast-growing Chinese smartphone makers.

column4: U.S. Ambassador Baucus says China hacking threatens national security
column5: BEIJING  June 25 Cyber theft of trade secrets by China is a threat to U.S. national security  U.S. Ambassador to China Max Baucus said on Wednesday in the first major public address of his tenure  warning that Washington would continue to pressure Beijing.

column4: Oculus denies claims by ZeniMax in virtual reality tech lawsuit
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  June 25 Virtual-reality technology startup Oculus VR denied allegations by videogame publisher ZeniMax Media Inc that it stole trade secrets during development of a gaming headset in a response filed in a federal court on Wednesday.

column5: WELLINGTON U.S. chipmaker and technology company Intel Corp said on Thursday it has invested in a New Zealand company producing software for use in sports and exercise sectors.

column4: EU Commission rejects Dutch bid to rule on Liberty  Ziggo deal

column4: AbbVie presses case for Shire deal and urges talks
column5: LONDON U.S. drugmaker AbbVie  said on Wednesday it wanted to move rapidly to clinch a takeover of Shire  as it set out the strategic rationale for buying the London-listed company  which has spurned its $46 billion offer.

column4: BRIEF-Shire says AbbVie announcement contains no new material information
column5: * Notes today's announcement by Abbvie inc. ("abbvie") repeating its proposal of May 30  2014  which comprised £20.44 in cash and 0.7988 AbbVie shares per shire share ( "proposal")

column4: UPDATE 3-AbbVie presses case for Shire deal and urges talks
column5: (Refiled to remove extraneous text characters in headline)

column4: BUZZ-AbbVie Inc and Shire Plc: AbbVie CEO does not rule out hostile move
column5: ** AbbVie up 2.6 pct at $54.99  Shire's  U.S.-listed shares up 2 pct at $228

column4: AbbVie CEO not ruling out hostile move on Shire
column5: LONDON U.S. drugmaker AbbVie  declined to rule out a hostile bid for Shire  on Wednesday but said it was pushing hard for the London-listed drugmaker to engage in talks  after its $46 billion takeover approach was rejected.

column4: AbbVie CEO not ruling out hostile move on Shire
column5: LONDON  June 25 U.S. drugmaker AbbVie  declined to rule out a hostile bid for Shire on Wednesday but said it was pushing hard for the London-listed drugmaker to engage in talks  after its $46 billion takeover approach was rejected.

column4: Patent win helps Shire as AbbVie plots next bid move
column5: LONDON Shire   which has spurned a $46 billion takeover offer from U.S. group AbbVie  as inadequate  has a new reason to argue it is worth more after a U.S. court backed patent claims on its top-selling drug Vyvanse.

column4: UPDATE 1-Patent win helps Shire as AbbVie plots next bid move
column5: * U.S. firm needs to raise bid to win Shire  investors say   (Recasts with more details on AbbVie's plans  Shire shares)

column4: U.S. court backs Shire in patent fight over Vyvanse drug
column5: LONDON  June 25 Shire  which is seeking to defend itself after receiving a $46 billion approach from U.S. group AbbVie  said on Wednesday a U.S. court had endorsed its patents on top-selling hyperactivity drug Vyvanse.

column4: Vodafone to win EU approval for $9.8 billion Ono deal: sources
column5: BRUSSELS/LONDON Vodafone is set to gain unconditional EU approval for its 7.2-billion-euro ($9.79 billion) bid for Spain's largest cable operator Ono as regulators do not have competition concerns  three people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column5: June 25 B2Gold Corp  a small Canadian gold mining company  said on Wednesday a security guard at its Masbate gold mine in the Philippines had been shot dead by a fellow security employee following an altercation between the two.

column5: June 25 B2Gold Corp  a small Canadian gold mining company  said on Wednesday a security guard at its Masbate gold project in the Philippines had been shot dead by a fellow security employee following an altercation between the two.
